Text: awesome undertaking buddy, and I thank you on my and the communities behalf.
Oh this is GREAT!!!!! Thanks for sharing!!! Definitely useful for us motorheads out there...

Way cool!  I do hope you manage to get the full guide done as a .pdf, but I do understand - I've been doing research for a book I'm writing, working with Hollander 30, 40, 46, 56, 60, and 63.

My wife helping me as a research assistant has finally gotten quit of the "How much longer?" question!

If you do get it done, please let me know!  If you're willing, I can tell you which sections I'm interested in most specifically...

Having access to a newer edition of Hollander would be amazingly helpful to my current project - I've gone as far back as I need with with H30 (ca. 1945,) so that's fine.  But, I'm trying to cover 1945-now, or as close to "now" as I can get...
